q: But he concluded that the war in Iraq has been worth the cost and remained largely unapologetic about his handling of the conflict. Had the government of Saddam Hussein remained in power the Middle East would be far more perilous than it is today, he wrote in the 800-page book, which is released next Tuesday. A leading architect of the Iraq war, Mr Donald Rumsfeld was fired by Mr Bush in 2006 with US troops bogged down in Iraq.
